Latest Ex-post Management Fee Applied Period End

description:
This field indicates the date for each month on which the portfolio shall be rebalanced. Due to the fact that a portfolio usually consists of several underlying investments the portion of each investment within the total value of the portfolio may change over time as the underlying investments perform differently over time. Therefore, the share of each underlying investment of the total value of the portfolio must be rebalanced accordingly.

The Portfolio Balance Mask indicates when this rebalancing takes place in each month. In order to display the date for each month correctly they shall be separated by a pipe "|" (ASCII 124).

As an example, suppose the rebalancing for a portfolio shall take place on the 2nd of March, 2nd of June, 2nd of September and 2nd of December. Then the value within this field would be "||02||02||02||02". For another example, suppose the portfolio rebalancing shall take place on the 1st of Jan, 2nd of Feb, 3rd of Mar, 4th of Apr, 5th of May, 12th of Jun, 13th of Jul, 14th of Aug, 21st of Sep, 22nd of Oct, 6th of Nov and 8th of Dec. Then the corresponding value would be "01|02|03|04|05|12|13|14|21|22|06|08". In other words, for each month there shall exist a slot and all slots are separated by a pipe. The day of the month on which the rebalancing shall take place shall be indicated through a number, i.e. "DD". Note that only one day can be indicated for each month.
values: Sequence of integers seperated by pipe. For each month there must exist one slot within a day can be provided.

fieldName: Is Fund Compliant With Prudential Guidelines
description:
Is the fund a South African domiciled fund that is compliant with the prudential guidelines? If so, please provide this field with "yes".

The prudential guidelines for South African funds are based on the Financial Sector Regulation (FSR) Act. One of the core aspects of this act was to create a prudential regulator, the Prudential Authority (PA). For further information please consider the following website: https://www.resbank.co.za/PrudentialAuthority/Pages/default.aspx

Please note that this field is only applicable to funds domiciled in South Africa, i.e. "OFST010010 Fund Domicile Alpha-2" = "ZA".

However, the attribute may only be provided or displayed if funds associated to that "OFST900104 FE fundinfo Group Name" are investment trusts (INVT) or venture capital trusts, i.e. "OFST900184 Is Fund Investment Trust Or Venture Capital Trust Relevant" = "INVT" or = "VCT".

fieldName: Borrowing Limit Of INVT Or VCT
description: Description which defines the borrowing limit that is tolerated of investment trust or venture capital trust.

fieldName: Is Split Capital In INVT Or VCT
description: Is the capital within the investment trust or venture capital trust split? If so please provide this field with "yes", i.e. "OFST900189" = "yes". Otherwise, provide "no".

fieldName: Last Annual General Meeting Of INVT Or VCT
description: Indicates the date of the last annual general meeting of the investment trust or venture capital trust.

fieldName: Last Extraordinary General Meeting Of INVT Or VCT
description: Indicates the date of the last extraordinary general meeting of the investment trust or venture capital trust.

fieldName: Annual General Meeting Of INVT Or VCT
description: Description which indicates the month in which the annual general meeting of the investment trust or venture capital trust takes place.

fieldName: Next Annual General Meeting Of INVT Or VCT
description: Indicates the date of the next annual general meeting of the investment trust or venture capital trust.

fieldName: Fee Structure Of INVT Or VCT
description: The description shall clarify the structure of the fees applied within the investment trust or venture capital trust.

fieldName: Report Date Of INVT Or VCT
description: Indicates the date on which the investment trust or venture capital trust published its report.

Description of the activities of the investment trust or venture capital trust.

Please note that this field is linked to the "OFST900104 FE fundinfo Group Name". However, the attribute may only be provided or displayed if funds associated to that "OFST900104 FE fundinfo Group Name" are investment trusts (INVT) or venture capital trusts, i.e. "OFST900184 Is Fund Investment Trust Or Venture Capital Trust Relevant" = "INVT" or = "VCT".

Description of the ownership structure of the investment trust or venture capital trust.

Please note that this field is linked to the "OFST900104 FE fundinfo Group Name". However, the attribute may only be provided or displayed if funds associated to that "OFST900104 FE fundinfo Group Name" are investment trusts (INVT) or venture capital trusts, i.e. "OFST900184 Is Fund Investment Trust Or Venture Capital Trust Relevant" = "INVT" or = "VCT".

fieldName: Wind Up Provision Of INVT Or VCT
description: Description of the wind up provision of the investment trust or venture capital trust.
Name of the venture capital trust administrator in official documents.

If the share class is yet to be registered in the jurisdiction, the registration status of the share class in that jurisdiction. If this is not applicable, please leave blank. The XX in the data ID should be replaced with the two digit ISO country code of the jurisdiction. The possible values for this field are:
"to be registered" - the share class is planned to be registered in the jurisdiction but no documents have been filed yet.
"under registration" - documents have been filed for registration and are awaiting approval, but the share class is not yet registered in the jurisdiction.

In case of multiple directors, please separate the names by pipe "|" (ASCII 124).

description: This field is an internal field indicating which date official track record extension should be applied.

This field shall indicate whether the corresponding share class has a high water mark or not. In case the share class does have a high water mark, this field shall be set to "yes" and the corresponding high water mark shall be provided within the field "OFST451160 High Water Mark".

This field indicates whether a share class shall be distributed or not (i.e. restricted for use). If "Is Share Class Client Only" = "yes" the share class shall not be distributed, while a "no" means that no restrictions apply and all data of that share class can be distributed.

This field indicates the comment of the "OFST900113 Unit Status". It serves the same purpose as the field "OFST900299 Listing Status Comment", which is to comment important information based on the value of the linked field, in this case the "OFST900113 Unit Status".

fieldName: FE fundinfo Abbreviated Full Share Class Name
description:
This field indicates the fund name combined with the unit name. The field will basically combine the hFE fields "FundName35" and "UnitName35".
The values of both fields shall be separated by a special character "#". Thus, the value of the "FE fundinfo Abbreviated Full Share Class Name" will be of the form "FundName35" + " # " + "UnitName35". The field shall have at most 38 characters (35 characters for FundName35 and UnitName35 + 3 characters for spaces and "#").
example: Newton Gbl Higher Inc # Qly Div

description:
If the fund is available in a prospectus, the status of the prospectus. The possible values for this field are:
future – the prospectus has not been approved yet by the local authority.
pre-approved – the prospectus has been orally approved but is not effective yet.
current – the prospectus is effective.
Past – the prospectus is no longer effective.

This field indicates the manager ID which can be interpreted as the "OFST001000 Fund Group Name". However, as the field logic of the manager name of publiFund systems differs from the openfunds logic there must exist a separate field.
Determines the actual stage of the fund lifecycle.

If the fund is not sent any longer, the type of termination. If this is not applicable, please leave blank. The possible values for this field are:
“merger” – the fund has been merged into another.
“out of scope” – Management Company has changed for the fund, and the new company is not a FE fundinfo client.
“liquidation” – the fund is terminated by Management Company decision and will not be re-activated

If the share class is available in a prospectus, the status of the prospectus. The possible values for this field are:
future – the prospectus has not been approved yet by the local authority.
pre-approved – the prospectus has been orally approved but is not effective yet.
current – the prospectus is effective.
Past – the prospectus is no longer effective.
Refers to the investor type the ShareClass is aiming at (eligibility requirements).

fieldName: pF Share Class Type of Termination
description:
If the share class is not sent any longer, the type of termination. If this is not applicable, please leave blank. The possible values for this field are:
suspension – calculation of dynamic data has been suspended due to external factors.
Merger – the share class has been merged into another.
Out of scope – Management Company has changed for the share class, and the new company is not a FE fundinfo client.
Liquidation – the share class is terminated by Management Company decision and will not be re-activated
Date when an ETF has changed its corresponding index. Before that date a comparison between index and ETF might not be meaningful.

Is the fund compliant with ethical investing? Funds that invest in ethical investments and promote the wellbeing of the planet, such as funds that have an ethical criteria or strictly do not invest in harmful products such as tobacco or alcohol.

Is the fund a Charity fund? Funds with the investment focus ‘Charity’ usually represent investments in charity organisations with the aim to preserve or increase their value. This money can then be used to finance charity activities.

values: "Absolute Return" / "Risk Targeted Multi-asset Solutions" / "Concentrated" / "Capital Protection Targeted" / "None" / "Strategic" / "Target Maturity" / "Total Return"

description: Is the fund actively outperforming a specific benchmark?

Is the fund a smart tracker fund? Smart tracker funds are similar to passive tracking funds in that they choose an index to “track”, but instead of passively tracking it, they actively stock select the best components of an index or use some kind of active strategy to add some outperformance (beta) aspect to the portfolio to beat the index and not replicate it. Usually funds create their own index which is a selection from  a common index
A factor is a quantifiable characteristic of a security that to a large extent explains its risk-return profile.

Mixed Asset style reflects the equity allocation within the fund's portfolio. The funds can range from aggressive to conservative. 
Aggressive - Mixed Asset funds that seek an aggressive portfolio by mainly investing in volatile investments such as 60-85% equities (Australian funds: min. 80% growth assets).
Balanced - Funds that seek a balanced portfolio by investing equally among volatile and non-volatile investments such as 40-60% equities and bonds (Australian funds: 40-60% growth assets). 
Cautious - Mixed asset funds that seek a cautious portfolio by investing the majority of their capital into non-volatile investments such as bonds or money market instruments and smaller percentage of 20-40% to equities (Australian funds: max. 20% growth assets).
Flexible - Mixed asset funds that have the ability to change their portfolio at any given moment to take advantage of a strengthening asset class.  Lifestyle funds that change their asset mix from aggressive to cautious until a set maturity point.
Growth targeted – Australian mixed asset funds that invest a minimum of 60% and maximum of 80% of assets within growth assets.
Moderate – Australian mixed asset funds that invest 20-40% of assets within growth assets.
The type of strategy the hedge fund uses.

description:
Funds can sometimes be broken down into different share classes, which are usually promoted towards different types of investors; namely Retail, Institutional and Retail through 3rd party. FE uses a guideline policy of £25,000 (or currency equivalent) as the border between selecting retail and institutional. In case the fund has a high minimum initial investment, more than £25,000 and is denoted as retail, it will be marked as institutional on FE database.
In the UK it is possible for retail investors to buy into an institutional share class through either an ISA or via a platform or fund supermarket.  They take on the burden of high initial minimum investments by grouping together the pools of investor monies into one investment.  This type of shares should be marked as Retail through Third party.
The specific area the fund invests in depending on geographical focus chosen.

fieldName: Type Of Identification Code For The Financial Instrument
description:
One of the options in the following closed list to be used:
1 - ISO 6166 for ISIN code
2 - CUSIP (The Committee on Uniform Securities Identification Procedures number assigned by the CUSIP Service Bureau for U.S. and Canadian companies)
3 - SEDOL (Stock Exchange Daily Official List for the London Stock Exchange)
4 – WKN (Wertpapier Kenn-Nummer, the alphanumeric German identification number)
5 - Bloomberg Ticker (Bloomberg letters code that identify a company's securities)
6 - BBGID (The Bloomberg Global ID)
7 - Reuters RIC (Reuters instrument code)
8 – FIGI (Financial Instrument Global Identifier)
9 - Other code by members of the Association of National Numbering Agencies
99 - Code attributed by the undertaking"

Consistent with S2 & PRIIPS approach. If you want to use LEI use 9.

description: Indicates if an ISIN, marked as "institutional" in the field "OFST901004 CS Retail Or Institutional", is available to non-discretionary private clients of CS as per prospectus. If OFST901004 is "retail", leave empty. If OFST901004 is "institutional" then choose the correct value (either "yes" or "no").

fieldName: CS Forced Redemption If Fee-based Advisory Agreement Is Terminated
description:
Indicates if the holdings in a share class available to investors with a fee-based advisory agreement have to be sold or the position switched if the advisory agreement with the distributor is terminated. If the share class is not available to end clients with fee-based advisory agreement ("OFST901007 CS Available To End Clients - Indicate If Only For Fee-based Advisory Agreement" = "no"), leave this field empty.
If the share class is available to end clients with fee-based advisory agreement ("OFST901007 CS Available to End Clients - Indicate If Only For Fee-based Advisory Agreement" = "yes" or "yes, only for fee-based advisory agreement"), choose the correct value ("yes", "no" or "yes, switch into another share class").

fieldName: CS Available To End Clients - Indicate If Only For Fee-based Advisory Agreement
description:
Indicates if an ISIN is available as per prospectus to end investors with fee-based advisory agreement/separate fee arrangement or similar.
If this is an institutional share class ("OFST901004 CS Retail Or Institutional" = "institutional"), which is not eligible for CS private clients without discretionary mandate ("OFST901005 CS Eligible For Private Clients Without Discretionary Mandate" = "no"), indicate "no".
If this is an institutional share class ("OFST901004 CS Retail Or Institutional" = "institutional"), which is eligible for private clients without discretionary mandate ("OFST901005CS Eligible For Private Clients Without Discretionary Mandate" = "yes"), choose the correct value ("yes" or "yes, only for fee-based advisory agreement").
If this is a retail share class ("OFST901004 CS Retail Or Institutional" = retail"), choose the correct value ("yes" or "yes, only for fee-based advisory agreement"). The value "yes" would mean it is available to all clients, while "yes, only for fee-based advisory agreement" means it is only for clients with fee-based advisory agreement.
Cannot be empty in case "OFST901017 Under CS Distribution Agreement / CS Appointed As Sub-distributor" is "yes" (i.e. share class is under CS distribution agreement).

fieldName: CS Available To End Clients With Fee-based Advisory Agreement With Country Restrictions
description:
Indicates if an ISIN is available as per prospectus to end investors with fee-based advisory agreement/separate fee arrangement with country restrictions.
If the share class is not available to end clients with fee-based advisory agreement ("OFST901007 CS Available to End Clients - Indicate If Only For Fee-based Advisory Agreement" = "no"), leave this field empty.
If the share class is available to end clients with fee-based advisory agreement ("OFST901007 CS Available to End Clients - Indicate If Only For Fee-based Advisory Agreement" = "yes" or "yes, only for fee-based advisory agreement"), choose the correct value ("no" or ISO 3166-1-alpha-3 code (i.e. SWE for Sweden).).
Multiple countries are separated by pipe "|" (ASCII 124) .
values: "no" or [List] of ISO 3166-1-alpha-3 country codes as it can be found on https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_3166-1 or on https://www.iso.org.

fieldName: CS Available To End Clients With Fee-based Advisory Agreement And With Minimum Subscription Amount Restrictions
description:
Indicates if an ISIN is available as per prospectus to end investors with fee-based advisory agreement/separate fee arrangement and additionally has minimum initial and/or subsequent subscription requirements that have not been waived at end investor level. The answer here depends on whether the share class has a minimum or not.
If the share class is not available to end clients with fee-based advisory agreement ("OFST901007 CS Available To End Clients - Indicate If Only For Fee-based Advisory Agreement" = "no"), leave this field empty.
If the share class is available to CS end clients with fee-based advisory agreement ("OFST901007 CS Available To End Clients - Indicate If Only For Fee-based Advisory Agreement" = "yes" or "yes, only for fee-based advisory agreement"), choose the correct value ("yes" or "no").

fieldName: CS Minimum Initial Subscription Amount Waived For CS
description:
Indicates if the minimum initial subscription amount is waived for CS.
If only "0" values are reported for "OFST400220 Minimal Initial Subscription In Shares" and/or "OFST400230 Minimal Initial Subscription In Amount", then leave empty.
If either "OFST400220 Minimal Initial Subscription In Shares" or "OFST400230 Minimal Initial Subscription In Amount" or both of them report a non-zero value, choose the correct value ("yes", "no" or "yes, with restrictions"). "yes" being equivalent to a general waiver, "yes, with restrictions" a waiver for certain clients (e.g. clients with a fee-based agreement, to be further specified in OFST901011) and "no" equals no waiver.

fieldName: CS Restrictions Of Minimum Initial Subscription Amount Waiver
description: The field needs to be completed only if "OFST901010 CS Minimum Initial Subscription Amount Waived For CS" has been marked with "yes, with restrictions”, otherwise, leave empty. This field indicates the restrictions attached to the waiver, e.g. only for RDR investors etc.
values: Free text, max. 150 characters including spaces without line brakes, bullets etc.
example: Only for investors in the UK

description:
Indicates the methodology that is used to calculate the price for subscriptions or redemptions.

Please use:
0 = Forward Pricing NAV
1 = Forward Pricing SSP (Swinging Single Pricing)
2 = Stock Exchange Price (usually only for ETFs and some closed-end-funds)
values: "0" (for "Forward Pricing NAV") / "1" (for "Forward Pricing SSP (Swinging Single Pricing)" / "2" (for "Stock Exchange Price (usually only for ETFs and some closed-end-funds)")

fieldName: CS Minimum Subsequent Subscription Amount Waived For CS
description:
Indicates if the minimum subsequent subscription amount is waived for CS.
If only "0" values are reported for "OFST400250 Minimal Subsequent Subscription In Shares" and/or "OFST400260 Minimal Subsequent Subscription In Amount" are both "0", then leave empty.
If "OFST400250 Minimal Subsequent Subscription In Shares" or "OFST400260 Minimal Subsequent Subscription In Amount" or both report a non-zero value, choose the correct value ("yes", "no" or "yes, with restrictions"). The value implicates the same as under field "OFST901010 CS Minimum Initial Subscription Amount Waived For CS".

fieldName: CS Restrictions Of Minimum Subsequent Subscription Amount Waiver
description: The field needs to be completed only if "OFST901013 CS Minimum Subsequent Subscription Amount Waived for CS" has been marked with "yes, with restrictions”, otherwise, leave empty. This field indicates the restrictions attached to the waiver, e.g. only for RDR investors.
values: Free text, max. 150 characters including spaces without line brakes, bullets etc.
example: Only for investors in the UK

description:
Indicates whether the portfolio or NAV is hedged. This is a linked field to "OFST020262 Share Class NAV Hedge". Possible Values are:

No hedge: Currency exposure remains the same. Just calculation and accounting currency changes.

NAV hedge: Due to the NAV hedge the performance in "OFST020540 Share Class Currency" equals the performance in "OFST010410 Fund Currency" adjusted for the interest rate differential minus hedge costs.

Full portfolio hedge: Exact hedging of non-Fund Currency positions within fund.

Currency overlay: Currency allocation is a separate process in the investment decision. It considers both active views and optimization aspects.

Partial hedge: Guidelines limit exposure to currencies other than the fund currency to 10%. Implementation can include tactical views of fund manager.
values: "no hedge" / "NAV hedge" / "full portfolio hedge" / "currency overlay" / "partial hedge"

Is the fund Complex or Standard? A fund is considered as Standard if all the following conditions are met: 
 - Fund with an official ISIN 
 - Fund which do not require specific documentation to be submitted to the transfer agent prior to each subsequent trade 
 - Fund which do not authorize partial redemption 
 - Fund with performance fees taken out of the NAV
A fund is considered as Complex if any of the above criteria for Standard Funds is not met

The Cooperation Agreement name refers to the overall "brand" name of the fund provider legal entity(ies) in the Cooperation Agreement with UBS. Should only one UBS Provider Name be defined in column B, then the Cooperation Agreement name is the same as the UBS Provider Name. Should more than one UBS Provider Names be defined in column B, then a Cooperation Agreement name will be defined by UBS and proposed to you in the Operational Fund Data Template.

Please mention the name of the legal entity(ies) in charge of the promotion of the funds as defined in the UBS Cooperation Agreement (ie name on the legal entity(ies) in the Cooperation Agreement’s title page).
Please mention whether the share class is subject to remuneration for UBS: If trailer fees or distribution fees are paid, then the field has to be answered by "yes".

NR - Notified - Rejected by the HOST authority

R - Registered

RX - No more registered
